column4: Oh hay guys, problem. Something is hemorraging space. I never have any room, and can't restart because I end up with so little free space xorg doesn't start. Is there perhaps an immediate diagnosis or a visualization of my hard drive I can obtain?
du -h should give you a clue
and df -h shows 100% on root partition?
go to /var/log/messages and do a du -h inside this directory; pastebin the output of that
yours is the first ubuntu that didnt have the /var/log/ as a directory :)
oh ok my bad (didnt realize that i had asked you to cd to /var/log/messages)
can you cd to /var/log and then run du -h . inside it pls
the logs look cool; how much disk space do you totally have?
one area where you can immediately salvage some disk space is in your /usr/share/doc
just delete everything inside that directory as none of us reads the documentation (we come to #ubuntu straight)
